website_summaries.verdict: The best liquid cooling option for most PC gaming rigs with quality components.
pros: Large radiator sports 2 near-silent fans to provide ample airflow when cooling the circulating liquid
Pump speed is adjustable to choose between performance and quiet operation
Software allows you to make adjustments
cons: Corsair software is difficult to set up and use for some people
Cooler includes a lot of wires

customer_reviews.title: I bought one of these in January 2017 and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in January 2017 and it lasted a few months before the pump died. I tried to contact Corsair about the warranty and never heard back. I decided it was probably just a one-off and replaced it with another, purchased in May 2017. Here I am in September in the same position. Thankfully modern CPUs aren’t as sensitive to these sort of things and there hasn’t been any damage, but once again I find myself without a functioning PC. I’m done giving Corsair the benefit of the doubt, I’ll be replacing this with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: jakenburg

customer_reviews.title: Great for a year...
customer_reviews.text: Bought just over a year ago based on good reviews. My pc is always on so I can record OTA television I work on as well as video editing and gaming. Came home from a job to find all my fans screaming and my cpu nearing 90°C. Pump speed was 0 RPM. Hopefully my CPU is still ok, but not happy with a 1 year lifespan. I read the horrors or RMA dealings and just decided to buy another CPU cooler rather than go through that. I was sceptical about water cooling (this was my first experience), now I remember why...
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from Corsair AIO liquid coolers!!!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly purchase something else! This is my third Corsair AIO liquid cooler that has died on me and I only owned them for a year or less. The RMA process is a nightmare with Corsair and it takes them forever to respond. The best part is you won't know your cooler has died unless you watch your temps closely. 2-H80's and 1-H100iv2 (after returning the first defective one) are dead now. I don't even leave my computer on all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D. Arneson

customer_reviews.title: Pump failure
customer_reviews.text: Hi I have bought a h100i v2 before about 6 months and it was working well but suddenly yesterday I turned on my pc and the fans was so loud and the temp was 80+ idle when I checked it was the pump it 0 rpm and I don't know what to do so I tried plugging and unplugging and still it doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: I had to reinstalled it 3 times on a new system I built. The pump would lite up and the fans would run, but there was no sound coming from it or signs it was running at all, I'm not a novice to building computers. The cpu started overheating 90-100 c every time. I used the arcitclean kit and arctic compound as was suggested with no improvement. Ended up getting another pump from another make, which worked. Now my system runs 20-30 c idle, 28-48 c during heavy game play. The corsair pump was dead on arrival and now it's a month later, so not able R.M.A. this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 10 months, then died like others have said.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had listened to the reviews. But i assumed all the bad reviews were user error, or improper setup. I was totally wrong. I got home today and heard my computer making noise like it was a jet engine fixing to take off. Upon investigation found that the cpu fan had an error, after less than a year...!!! I will be making an attempt to perform the warranty method, however, I expect it to be a headache like other people have said. I hope it hasnt done any permanent damage to my pc. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!! Based on how the customer support goes, this may be my last corsair product going forward.
customer_reviews.author: butterbath

customer_reviews.title: BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK
customer_reviews.text: It didn't last a year before the pump broke. When a pump breaks you get no warning at all, so you're entire system is HOT until you finally notice it or your PC gets your attention by shutting down on you, which is what happened to me. Not only does Corsair refuse to issue me a refund, only a replacement, but they expect the customer to pay for the return shipping. They'll sell you a defective product and give you the worst customer relation experience you can imagine. The warranty might be 5 years but it is still the worst I have encountered. DO NOT BUY CORSAIR, you will regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Starkey

customer_reviews.title: When it works it's good however 2 pump failures within the first 6 months ...
customer_reviews.text: When it works it's good however 2 pump failures within the first 6 months of owning = absolute garbage quality control, to top it off Corsair don't appear to be offering me a refund after the 2nd failure. Will never touch a corsair product ever again. I think I'll go down the line of trying to reverse the credit card transaction at this point. See support ticket #625753 (old), #647080 (current) if you want to validate my review Corsair
customer_reviews.author: C D Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler, keeps your CPU temps where you want them.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I have no complaints with this cooler. I had issues with the one I received from amazon. It was DOA. It also looked like it was previously installed, based on the stock thermal paste having obviously been disturbed by a CPU. I bought a new one locally, and returned the original one to Amazon with no problem. That issue aside, this thing does it's job very well. I don't even have to turn the fans up above 40% or so to keep the CPU cool. I have it cooling an i7-7700k that's overclocked to 5GHz @ 1.35V and it keeps it in the low to mid 60s while gaming. It stays nice and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C.

customer_reviews.title: Solved my overheating issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought a factory over clocked cpu without realizing it. When the cpu was under the slightest load it would overheat and shut down my computer. I eventually bought a new case that could fit the radiator and this product. After I transferred everything over my overheating issues went away instantly. My cpu now never gets hotter than 40 degrees C even under heavy load. It used to idle at 50 degrees C. This cooling system is a monster and will keep the hottest running cpus cool. I would reccomend this to anyone who wants to get the most out of their cpu. If you found this review helpful then please hit that helpful button.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle and Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Temperature is lower :)
customer_reviews.text: Pros : great gear, really fixed my cpu from overheating. My games are'nt crashing anymore. Installed on a AMD FX 8370 8CORE. Cons: major issue was trying to figure what parts lead to what ? owners manual didn't feel self explanatory. Had to look up YOUTUBE videos and they were just as helpful. I recommend an extra pair of hands to help, cause installing the radiator with the fans was tough, hooking it up to the front of my tower case.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Loud, high price and doesnt mount correctly on newer mobo's.
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: *Corsair *Design Con's: *CPU mounting hardware doesn't properly fit ASUS ROG Maximus IX Formula LGA 1151 (or newer motherboards) *Fan's are very loud compared to other brands (i.e. Intel, Thermaltake) *Price Although I love Corsair, I have a tower, keyboard, mouse, RAM, power supply all by them, this water cooling setup doesn't work on newer systems unless you happen to have the older metal mounting hardware (I know because that's what I have at work from a kit 1+ years old).
customer_reviews.author: Shawn John

customer_reviews.title: This Cooler is dead after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: i bought this item on December 2017 to cool my Core i7-7700k (not overclocked). Over years, working great. But few days ago my PC case fans are very loud. I restarted my PC and BIOS said "CPU Fan Error, CPU over temperature". i checked cooler cables, they're ok & cooler is dead. So i request RMA and replaced with H100i PRO (because H100i V2 is discontinued). Yesterday i installed replacement cooler, now it's working fine. Final : my advise is don't buy H100i v2. Because i'm not only one. There is many people said same as me. This product working fine for 1 years only.
customer_reviews.author: Sambuu-Yondon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing Water Cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is a stellar cooler. The cables are very flexible for positioning, it does an excellent job cooling, and it looks cool (if you care about that). Installation is hassle-free. If you've ever installing a case fan before, this will be a walk in the park. If you haven't 15 seconds of looking at the manual will solve your problems. It even has high quality thermal paste pre-applied. The biggest note I would make to the amateur builder, is to be sure that you either plug the USB Micro cable in BEFORE installing, or position it over your CPU so that you can reach it. Otherwise you'll need to reinstall it.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar

customer_reviews.title: Debris in the loop causing overheating
customer_reviews.text: It works, however mine appears to have debris on the inside. I have had to move my system and it necessitated laying it on its side, this has caused debris to clog the ports on the cooler which in turn cased the CPU to over heat and throttle. I had not overclocked my system and this is preventing me for doing so. I was able to hear the debris hitting the impellers in the block. By forcing full pump speed I was able to clear the block and it has started cooling, but am disappointed in the quality for only being a year old.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ketre

customer_reviews.title: Going back to air
customer_reviews.text: All my friends said AIO was the way of the future..... Ive never had a air based cpu cooler fail. Many years of zalman aftermarket coolers under my proverbial belt... But the pump on this AIO failed in under a month for me with mild use on a 5820K. Im disgusted to say the least, I understand DOA parts, but the poop tier level of reliability at play here is unforgivable.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for my i5 760
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cooler to improve my overclocking ability on my i5 760. I went from a Hyper 212 Evo running 3.4 Ghz at 80 degrees celsius, to 4 Ghz and never higher than 60 degrees celsius with this AIO. Installation was easy and the instructions were easy to understand, my only issue was the tubes were a little stiff and hard to bend towards my CPU. I had it up and running in roughly 30 minutes. I have not experienced any leaks or malfunctions of any kind, and the pump and fans are really quiet. Overall this is very good cooler and I would definitely recommend. Pros: -Fantastic Cooling -Quiet -Easy to install Cons: -Stiff tubing
customer_reviews.author: Christy Gallops

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU cooler!
customer_reviews.text: I really don't know what all the negative reviews are about. The H100i v2 works like a champ. Reduced my temps dramatically, and was (mostly) easy as pie to install. The pre-mounted Intel bracket was a bear to remove, since I was following the instructions to turn in clockwise. It actually detached by turning COUNTER-clockwise. Other than that, was a breeze to install and get running. Don't forget to download the Corsair LINK software for maximum utility and configuration options.
customer_reviews.author: Corvus

customer_reviews.title: 2 Failed in 13 months, bad pumps
customer_reviews.text: FAIL!!! 2 units in 13 months Went through two of these in 13 months, now Corsair is trying to knock 10% off on the refund saying the unit refund in dropped 10% every year even though the junk replacement they sent after refusing to give me a refund broke after 3 months. Also, you have to pay shipping when sending units back so I'm out another $30.00 after having to send 2 back. I'll never use Corsair again...
customer_reviews.author: D.Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Worked out just fine for me
customer_reviews.text: After ordering this I began to worry with all of the negative reviews pointing out how many units have failed, and I also thought I'd made an error in assuming this would fit my AM4 chip Turns out it has been working just fine (and isn't all that loud in my opinion) and now includes an AM4 bracket Keeps my Ryzen 7 1700X cool, even when running Prime95 full tilt for over an hour - very impressed with the value Will update my review IF there are issues in the future
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work first time.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for friend to install but because of the mother board the height of one fan didn't allow it to fit on top of case. So purchased a slim design fan and when she hooked up cooler....POP. Yup toast so contacted Amazon got a return RMA they picked up DOA one and sent another. She installed slim fan hooked up and Whirrrr it works! So 4 stars instead of 5 but great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Evaporation After 1.5 Years
customer_reviews.text: Kept the system relatively cool at first, but it seems a good portion of the water in the loop has evaporated after only a year and a half. I have been using this on an i7-7700K which runs pretty high temps as-is, but my baseline idle temps have been slowly creeping up over time. At this point, I'm idling just over 60C and if I run any intense games I will quickly start getting high temp warnings as it approaches and goes over 90C. Needless to say I'm replacing this cooler with, hopefully, something a little more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Cale

customer_reviews.title: Pump Failed after 1 year, ignored by Corsair customer support, and non-functioning RGB
customer_reviews.text: This cooler failed during idle after only a year. The failure of the pump caused my processor to reach over 100C. After reading similar reviews about the same issue, and contacting Corsair only to be ignored, even though they offer a 5 year warranty, I will not be purchasing another Corsair product, and would never recommend this cooler in any custom pc, as the chance of damaging your processor is too high for the price point. Buy the NZXT Kraken instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Cool and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Cools my Intel Boxed Core I7-6700K 4.00 GHz 8M Processor Cache 4 LGA 1151 bought from here as well. Cools it to a comfortable 30°C while I am overclocking my processor AND playing certain games on maximum settings. Well, to be fair, I have seen the temps raise up to around 36°C at times too depending on the game. And when it is idling - well, the temp is laughably low. Does this do it's job? Probably better than some of your co-workers do. It works. All the time. Can we honestly say the same? :)
customer_reviews.author: James R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Mine included the AM4 plate !
customer_reviews.text: Installing the AM4 plate for my Ryzen 2600 was easy. Removing the pre-installed intel plate was a pain in the ***. Instructions say that to remove the plate you only need a 1/8th turn, but it wouldn't budge. Eventually, I re-read the instructions. Push down, then rotate. Doh! I was only rotating. Clicked the old plate off. Clicked the new plate on. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: D.W

customer_reviews.title: I think the v2 sucks as I've had the v1 running in my old ...
customer_reviews.text: The water pump died after 6 months of usage. Had frustrating issues with heat ramping too quickly before the pump and fans kicked in. My idle temps were 40C and it would spike to 80C all the time with this pump, but now with my new Thermaltake cooler has idle temps of 25C and a stress test takes it up to 60C after 20 minutes. I have a i7-6900K with the highest core clocked at 4.6GHZ. I think the v2 sucks as I've had the v1 running in my old computer for 2 years without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Deus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cooler
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler!! upgraded from a Zalman fan cooler that I have had for 8 years... this bad boy keeps my CPU around 80 to 90 while I'm gaming so definetly worth it to protect my processor. Install was easier than my old Zalman aswell. corsair link is very basic but great for checking temps on your devices. I recommend this to anybody who is afraid to make the jump to water cooling. you won't regret it and it will make u admire your rig again if it has become boring and bland to you.
customer_reviews.author: T. Raney

customer_reviews.title: Price worthy for the Cooling provided.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my H80i was not keeping up with my processors heat production due to one of the fans going out. While it did take my wife and I both to get it into my Corsair 750D case (it fit like a glove), the cooling difference was instantly noticeable. I dropped over 15 degrees Fahrenheit instantly and it freed a lot more space up to improve airflow in my case. As a side note, I used Arctic Silver for the thermal paste as I do not trust the stuff that comes pre-spread on the cooler from the manufacturer; just like I did for the H80i.
customer_reviews.author: Kalugyer

customer_reviews.title: Scratched and Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Radiator is scratched on one edge, there's a 5inch long streak but I don't care about that. I can't actually use or install or this because I'm missing the x8 long screws, the x16 washers, and the x4 thumb screws, they were nowhere in the box. After going through Corsair’s support they sent me some of the screws I asked for but I’m still missing the thumb screws, they’re refusing to supply them. I’m going to either find another cooler or try to mount it on the CPU with what I have but it definitely won’t be in the way it was intended. The fans are nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Karper

customer_reviews.title: RGB is not flashy at all
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is amazing, build quality is exceptional and overall efficiency is fantastic. CONS If you are looking for some crazy RGB cooler with lots of lights, look elsewhere. The only part that lights up is the logo and it is very dim. PROS The Corsair iQue technology lets you constantly monitor your CPUs temp which is very helpful. CPU contact point comes with pre-applied thermal paste.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I have RMA'd my cooler over 3 times now, ...
customer_reviews.text: I have RMA'd my cooler over 3 times now, all of my units have had the pump fail. Before you buy, google "h100iv2 loud pump" and listen for yourself. If you need something that will only need to work for 2 months at a time, sure go ahead and buy.
customer_reviews.author: frookie coop

customer_reviews.title: Pump failure after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: This AIO cooler did a good job of keeping my 6700K cool and I would have seen even greater performance if I were to delid the CPU. Unfortunately the pump died only after 3 months. Express RMA from Corsair will take 7 days to ship out a new one... I recommend sticking with traditional air coolers since the reliability has been pretty shoddy in my experiences using AIO coolers.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B

customer_reviews.title: 2/6 dead within 10 months
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 6 of these in January. One of the pumps failed within the first month of install. The 2nd one just went. So in less than 10 months of usage, 2 of the 6 I ordered the pumps are dead. The fans still spin, but its the pump itself that dies. No water pumping=no cooling= overheated CPU temps , dangerous. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dowhy

customer_reviews.title: Works really great when its doing its job
customer_reviews.text: 5 month review: Works really great when its doing its job. kept my CPU at a Cool 30c under no load. But 2 days ago the pump decided just not to work anymore . It is a very common issue with this CPU cooler. I thought to myself it wouldn't happen to me. To my luck it did and only lasted 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: luciano

customer_reviews.title: Best aio coolers.
customer_reviews.text: One of the company I trust. Especially, cooling cpu. This a great cooler. 5 yr warrenty. 240mm 30mm thick. It has am4 brackets. The pre paste is decent. But, it's a lot better ( a few degrees off) if you use your favorite thermal paste. I like to use GC-extreme. The fan is actually good. 70.69cfm@ 2435rpm. Noise, who cares but, it's around 37 dba. Reliability can vary. I have a older 240mm aio from corsair. 5 years and the pump is still working well.
customer_reviews.author: Gogo PLata

customer_reviews.title: Love this CPU cooler!
customer_reviews.text: I love this CPU cooler it is perfect for overclocking. I got this to replace a master cooler hyper 212 in my new PC build and it is great. Installation was simple and easy, it even comes with thermal paste already applied. (be sure to check for leaks first) Once the cooler was on my new rig it fired right up and has kept my CPU nice and cold. Also this thing runs nice and quiet considering all the stuff it has going on...I have 4 fans on the radiator and then it also has the water pump to circulate the water.
customer_reviews.author: CCKRUSE

customer_reviews.title: DOA Sent back, New one is Great
customer_reviews.text: This won't be a long review... Had to send this one (h100i v2) because it was DOA! Amazon customer service is great as usual. Went to BestBuy to get the new one and it works great. Minus one star only due to the initial bad unit. No complaints about the performance of the working unit. Keeps my overcooked 6700k CPU cool consistently. Also the case I have it installed in is a Phanteks - Enthoo Pro M ATX Mid Tower Case Grey or Gunmetal.
customer_reviews.author: PikeG2

customer_reviews.title: H100i V2 is broken. Stopped working after 8 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Short story: I bought this corsair hydro series H100i v2 last summer and built my own computer on last september (2016). Few weeks ago my computer did not work showing me a fan error and a high temperature on my CPU, almost on 90°C. I open the case and everything was looking to work ok. All the fans were running but the error and alert were still showing up. A technician recommended me to try with a different system of refrigeration and now everything is ok. What it seems is that the H100i V2 wascdamage now or stuck. I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Juan P.

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed after about 1 year of normal use
customer_reviews.text: A few days ago my fans started to spin up faster and faster. It got super loud so I went to the software and it showed the pump RPM was reading 0 and I could not change it. CPU temp was reading 75 degrees and climbing until it just shut off. For a product that is rated for 5 years but only last 20% of the life needs to be pulled from amazon. Motherboard - MSI X370 Gaming Pro Carbon CPU - AMD 1600X
customer_reviews.author: Joseph and Anne Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality radiator fans
customer_reviews.text: Product failed after 6 months. My computer sounds like an old truck. Searching online reveals that the radiator fans are extremely low quality. Complaints about rattling sounds .... Which is exactly what I have. I used to think Corsair is a high quality brand but this product is clearly not. I paid a premium and now I have to replace the fans. Would definitely think twice before purchasing Corsair again!
customer_reviews.author: rgviva

customer_reviews.title: Burst over my new rig within a week...
customer_reviews.text: I was lucky to be home when it burst to immediately mitigate some of the potential liquid damage to my new components...IMO, Corsair should do a better job with product QA! EDIT: I got my money back from Amazon and went with another product that appears to be significantly more reliable!
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler, if you do a push-pull system it works even better, I have it on my 7600k thats OCed to 4.7, and I get an idle of around 26, and on hard tests with prime and OCCT and so on, it maxes out around 55. My favorite part was the block, had two ports connected to it for the fans so you don't need to buy a splitter. Putting it on was very easy, the pipes are a bit stiff but I do have a fairly small case. Pros: Quiet Powerful Looks nice Feels sturdy Cons: Nothing. Just make sure you can fit it :)
customer_reviews.author: Kody

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well for the first 5 months I had it. One day my fans just went wild on me and I checked temps to see (to my dismay) my CPU over 70c. Immediately shut off the computer and waited a litttle, when I rebooted it gave me a cpu fan error and went to bios to see the pump wasn't working. Not exactly what I expected from Corsair but support has been good about the warranty replacement. I'm just not sure I trust another one again though, using an air cooler for now.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Cooler for a build
customer_reviews.text: I'm able to put this cooler almost anywhere in my PC. It was my first pick for my build and I must say that it is a great cooler. I am running a 6700k over clocked stably at 4.5ghz and it keeps it cool. Also, the corsair logo lights up in any color to match your build. I haven't experienced any problems with it, but one struggle I had with putting this together was that there are 2 sets of standoffs that look very similar, and I picked the wrong ones first. Other than that, great cooler overall. I also used it in my first build, which I can say makes it pretty easy to install. Not complicated at all
customer_reviews.author: william Kaye

customer_reviews.title: This Cooler is GREAT for games or heavy CPU users.
customer_reviews.text: I had the H100i GTX model and the pump burned out. I ordered this one as the upgrade to that, because I couldn't wait for the RMA to be returned, and needed to get my computer back up and running. I'm very glad I did, as this has been keeping my CPU icy cool and running like a champ! Easy to install, especially since I had done it once before. And since my CPU had been running close to 90C after the pump burnt out on the first one. After installing this CPU cooler, it's now running at barely 40C even under heavy load. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Maeder

customer_reviews.title: the value is good if you dont care about having an absolutely silent ...
customer_reviews.text: air bubble noise is somewhat noticeable, I have heard stories of this going away, but I would probably shop around for a more expensive all in one unit, the value is good if you dont care about having an absolutely silent machine. The unit functions well though, (I used an aftermarket thermal paste) and my cpu never reaches above 40C even under heavy use with 2 pushing noctua fan units barely spinning.
customer_reviews.author: afss

customer_reviews.title: Easy to do
customer_reviews.text: Used it in my latest computer build and it works flawlessly. Keeps my I7 Kaby Lake temp in the mid 30's C. I have provided a picture of it inside my latest computer build. Make sure you don't touch the paste when you attach it to the chip. Easy to do. Ask me how I know. :-) Worked fine anyway. Come with both the Intel and AMD chip setup kits. Seems very high quality and is solid. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeDirective

customer_reviews.title: So the cooler keeps running at full speed because it thinks the cpu is hot when its notand so it's really annoying. I think the wire broke for the cpu ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked so well for 7 months and today it decided to die in the middle of a game. The fan still workes but in bios it does not read the rpm. So the cooler keeps running at full speed because it thinks the cpu is hot when its notand so it's really annoying. I think the wire broke for the cpu fan part broke not the usb connecting part because I can read the cooler in the computer software and in there the rpm works. It's just the bios that doesn't read it
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Work Great For A Very SHORT TIME
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 5 or so months. Gave out with out a warning. With in 2 minutes after I turned on my i7-6800K reached 198° after pressing the power button.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: First was used returned then got a what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: First one I got was used and was missing stock thermal paste, second one came on time and was as expected easy to install and got the job done well. I use it for my 4.7ghz OC on my i5 4690k. It is a little loud even on quiet mode and is louder on idle than the stock fans. If you want silence go with air but otherwise it is fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Super cooler for your gaming rig.
customer_reviews.text: I built a new machine for gaming and have the I7 6700 chip and wanted to make sure it stayed cool. I have a friend who uses water cooling and decided to give it a try. I big unit so you need lots of space in your case. Installation is straight forward, takes a bit to get the cooling lines where you like them, but it runs great. The downloadable Corsair monitoring utility is super neat, shows ALL your fans and ALL your installed component temperatures. You can set up temperature alarms and see how everything is running at a glance. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. Goodnough

customer_reviews.title: The pump failed and .....
customer_reviews.text: I called corsair to have it exchanged. The tech guy i spoke with agreed that the pump failed and needed exchanging but when i started the return email log with the returns department , they were saying that my pump was good and it did not fail....even thow i got a warning that the cpu was overheating. incredible. i will never buy another corsair device....if you need to return in for warrantee they will deny your claim. so i returned it to amazon instead.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei Doroftei

customer_reviews.title: Top notch high performance AIO CPU cooler
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my custom water loop pump when it started dying. Since I replaced my GPU, I decided not to go back to a custom loop. I got the H100i v2, for my CPU. The AIO has exceeded my expectations, it keeps my CPU just as cool as my custom loop did, with maybe 1 or 2 degrees higher at load. Installation was easy. The software is simple. This works very well, and I do overclock my CPU. It keeps it very cool versus an air cooler. If you don't want to deal with the maintenance if a custom water loop, and only need to cool the CPU, I recommend that Corsair Hydro Series H100i v2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hardware 5/5, software not so much.
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is great! I have an i5 6600k OC'd to 4.5 Ghz at 1.252 volts and under full loads it almost never goes over 40 C. However, with that said, the Corsair Link software does leave more to be desired. While it's good for controlling your CPU fans, it has zero control over your case fans. This had me looking for another fan solution for the rest of my fans. I went with the Asus Fan Xpert+, but that application doesn't let me exclude the CPU fans from control. So instead of mirroring the fan curves, I simply uninstalled the Link software.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: First unit died after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for seven months of daily use, and then it sat idle for a month, and when I turned it back on the pump started making clicking and grinding noises and my CPU overheated very quickly without much warning. I've opened a trouble ticket to get it replaced, but I hope it doesn't fail again. I found one other user online who reported one dying after seven months. They have a five year warranty, so it should be covered, but it's still very inconvenient to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working for no reason after about 8 months. Beware
customer_reviews.text: Alright, so I received this cooler a while back when I was building my own pic, and all was working perfectly until the pump just decided to stop working. I contacted corsair support, and they told me this happens to a lot of people 6+ months after they purchased the product. Hmm Never the less, I did an RMA on it. Everything went smoothly, and I got a new one in about a week or so. I reccomend this product and would give it 5 stars if it worked flawlessly, but sadly it didn't. I'm sure if you run into any issues however, corrsair will gladly help!
customer_reviews.author: Coulter

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months and isn't that silent anyways
customer_reviews.text: I got it for Ryzen and it took weeks to even get the proper mount but I understand that was AMD's fault. But the cooler itself was super loud to the point that I bought an iPad just to do the small things like email and around 6 months after buying it it just broke. Light still comes on but the cooling didn't work and the motherboard didn't even recognize it. It was awful and made me lose three days of work. I got a good $30 Thermaltake Cooler and it works better anyways. Waste of 100+ dollars. Wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: euroxin

customer_reviews.title: Overheat, bet you can't.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps me under 29c idle. Rarely goes above 65c or so when I'm really trying to destroy my processor. Running an i7 7700k under this cooling solution. I would definitely recommend this cooler. I do wish the hoses were a bit more flexible, getting them into an ideal spot can be a bit of a challenge. The trick to getting them to cooperate is by rotating them near the cooling block.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Was a bit difficult to fit it into my mid ...
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit difficult to fit it into my mid size pc case (needs 2 fan slots with enough clearance on the end with the tubes). I ended up using a 460 corsair instead of a NZXT S340 since it didn't support 240. Also unfortunate since I had to move the 3 customize able RGB front fans with side panel control to the other fan vents in order to fit the H100i v2. It looks a bit off but that's on me for not getting a larger pc case
customer_reviews.author: BobertphotoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: i7-6700k runs idle temp of 30C upon first boot.  Pump is next to dead silent.
customer_reviews.text: i7-6700k runs idle temp of 30C upon first boot. Pump is next to dead silent. Put your hand on the tube and feel a slight vibration in hand to make sure it is working. Excellent quality. small con: the pre-applied thermal paste is not in a very good vacuum seal in the packaging. This could lead to dust particles in the pre-applied paste and hurt your temps. I would rather they didn't put the pre-applied paste on it and just ship a small tube/container of the paste to keep it from getting contaminated. Just go buy your own tube they are cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Wallynova

customer_reviews.title: I have it installed in my NZXT Phantom 820 case and it has made a 20c-25c different in CPU temp and I couldn't be happier! Insta
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised! I have it installed in my NZXT Phantom 820 case and it has made a 20c-25c different in CPU temp and I couldn't be happier! Installation may seem intimidating at first. If you are unsure YouTube a video and you should feel more confident. Fans are on the loud side, but think twice about replacing them. The stock fans can hit 2700 RPM which is crucial for those who overclock. Most brand name LED fans top out at 2000rpm, which is not bad but you want your radiator to stay as cool as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I love this product and was a dream scenario to have ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and was a dream scenario to have one when I got my 600t years ago. Depending on your motherboard and case size & setup you may need to mount your fans on the outside of the bracket as the inside may not fit. A side note that I have learned on forums discussing with others who have used Corsair's Link software with BOTH a Hybrid GPU cooler and H-series CPU cooler is that Link does not monitor BOTH. As this is software that doesn't affect the usage of the CPU side for me and software can be fixed/updated it is a minimal issue.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart M.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend you connect it directly to PSU and not to ...
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to setup if doing push set up unless you have another person hold the radiator while you screw in the fans. Keeps my i7 7700k from overheating even in the high humidity area Im in. Fans are quiet even when ran at 100% speed. Already comes with thermal paste so no need to apply and its already all evenly spread out. Took a star off since voltage that it draws is not as advertise drawing higher which could harm your mobo. I recommend you connect it directly to PSU and not to mobo cpu fan slots. Other than that it work greats
customer_reviews.author: JolliB

customer_reviews.title: 4 months in and it died.
customer_reviews.text: It was working great until a couple months in and it stopped working. I am trying to get a return/refund. I was very excited about my setup and adding this to it until my computer started up one day and was running 100C and the heatsink fan was as loud as a car trying to cool down.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: PSA for anyone having trouble changing/removing the mount plates:
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are as easy as explained in the instructions, but as much as I would press down on the plate and twist I saw that it was physically impossible to get it out. SO, all you have to do is unscrew the outer circle's screws to give enough for the plate's hooks to unhinge (do not touch the screws on the copper part). I suggest tightening all screws once the plates have been swapped afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I must say that I absolutely love Corsair computer components
customer_reviews.text: I must say that I absolutely love Corsair computer components! I'm running a Corsair PSU, Keyboard, Mouse, Lighting Node, and this AIO. This cooler is incredibly easy to use. The Corsair Link software lets me control everything, and it keeps my Intel i7-7700K nice and cool! I did upgrade the stock fans, but there's nothing wrong with the stock ones. I just wanted a little more static pressure. I am able to overclock safely and my CPU doesn't overheat under AVX.
customer_reviews.author: Andy D.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cooler but bad iCue sofware!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler does a very good job at cooling my Intel Core i7 8700k with temps averaging low 50's and on some games the low 60's. The reason I give this 4 stars and not 5 is because of the iCue software, I've been stuck running this thing on quite mode so I cant even get the lowest temps because everytime I back out of the iCue software it automatically resets the setting to quiet mode instead of extreme where I set it, even the a custom profile wont stay saved so I gave up since temps stay comfortable until my cpu hits 100 percent usage but that never happens in games anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ross

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, but HUGE
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE making is difficult to squeeze into a case. Even the case I bought from Corsair that was supposed to fit this thing had this pressed against the RAM. It does a fantastic job keeping the CPU cool though and is whisper quiet, which I also love. I was afraid it would be noisy, but I cannot even hear it when it kicks on.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It's a pleasure to have in my PC
customer_reviews.text: Have been cooling an i5 6600K with this for 5 months, many hours a day under 50% load most of the time. Highest temp hit 44C, usually it's 34C. It's very quiet. You have to really listen to hear anything. When you do it's usually the fans. You can play with the pump and fan speed settings in the Corsair control panel and hear how loud it could get. It's never worked hard in any of the games I play. It was easy to install. It's quiet. It's reliable. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I had the Hi100 For several years, great product but it eventually started failing. So I upgraded to this part. Back to nice cool temps. Install was just as easy as before, pretty simple all in one device. I think the fans may be thinner which allows for easy install for the smaller cases.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Mill

customer_reviews.title: Came with an AM4 bracket!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Holy AM4 bracket! This box came with a bracket! I have bought several of these and I am kind of PO'd about ordering the bracket from Corsair and paying for it when I didn't need to....
customer_reviews.author: Steve Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great part. Meh software.
customer_reviews.text: Besides amazon or ASUS (via USPS) delivering the package to the wrong house and having to send a replacement, this cooler is awesome! I'm having issues with Corsair Link and I've heard that it can be a pain, hence the 4 stars. It keeps my 7700k running cold and is not extremely loud. I had to put washers on the screws holding the fans to the radiator so they were tight up against it, but the washers were provided so that is no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great for  I9 7980XE 18 Cores (cost about 2.100US) dolars!
customer_reviews.text: Before my corsair cooler was very small.. My Processor I9 7980XE 18 Cores in Overclock get around 99o celcius or 210F Now with this great Hydro Series H100i V2, get around 40C 60C or 120F Very cool down temp.. I am very happy and satisfy.. I paid 2000USD for a I9 7980X And I can running overclock for 4.8GHZ and low temperatures and its great! Photos attached!
customer_reviews.author: Jonnys Bazar

customer_reviews.title: Good for the most part...But one issue
customer_reviews.text: The stock fans that come with this cooler are absolutely Horrendously Loud for litteraly no reason my CPU can litteraly be sitting at idle at barely 30°C and this thing is roaring like a rocketship just taking off even when in the Corsair link software having it set on quiet mode it's generally quiet but occasionally Roars up again for no particular reason then settles down again... So I HIGHLY recommend you replace the stock fans on this before installing unless you like the sound of a rocketship blasting off as soon as u turn on ur PC
customer_reviews.author: Troy.B

customer_reviews.title: Terrible software.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Get your software together corsair, link is awful and does not detect the pump. If you can, just buy something else because the software is terrible. Update: Broke today. Out of the blue, I was sitting on my couch and heard the fans start going faster. Turns out the pump died in less than a year. Please do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: E money

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on May 15, 2017 and the pump stopped working on 10/19/2017. My wife's gaming computer is now inoperable due to over heating and is in a repair shop getting a new cooling system installed. I will update this review with my experiences with Corsair's Customer Service department.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd Young

customer_reviews.title: Good product, Awful documentation.
customer_reviews.text: Using it on a ASRock Fatal1ty Z270 Gaming K6 with a Intel Intel Core i7-7700K. All in an Antec P280. With the radiator mounted to the top of the case, the radiator/fans BARELY clear the top of the motherboard and RAM slots. Easy to install once you figure out which bolts you need. Keeping temps down nicely while gaming, I can only hear it if I force it to max with the control software, though I have yet to really push it. As others have mentioned, the manual is terrible. There is absolutely no attempt to help differentiate between the different bolts for the different mounts.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: After 1.5 years of working well and silently, the pump has failed. I tried disconnecting everything and reconnecting them. I also changed bios settings to force 100% CPU fan usage but nothing worked. I decided to go with Noctua cooling setup instead because it would be MUST faster to fix my computer and not much more expensive than the Corsair RMA process. An air cooled system is also more reliable (fewer points of failure). There are too many reports of these water pumps failing... I regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: D. New

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Corsair radiator to fail, within a year of purchasing
customer_reviews.text: After owning the radiator for just ONE year the pump died. Support's been giving me the run-around for several days. Hopefully I'll hear back soon. Apparently some forums have said that the failures could be due to oxide buildup since they have a copper block and an aluminum radiator in the same loop (I barely watercool and I know this is the biggest mistake in the book). Even if they added a non-corrosive to the fluid that may have crystallized and jammed up the pump. This is my 3rd failed Corsair AiO. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: HAF n' HAF

customer_reviews.title: Installed on overclocked amd 8350 easily. Note that the included booklet was just average
customer_reviews.text: Installed on overclocked amd 8350 easily. Note that the included booklet was just average, use the manufacturer's YouTube install video tutorial instead. This is a big unit so expect to move a few items around in your case. Ram clearance needs to be a concern if you plan to top mount it. Cooling has significantly improved and even under heavy load this is still relatively quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using it with a fx-8350
customer_reviews.text: Using it with an overclocked fx-8350. 4.5ghz and hitting right around 30-35c avg. and about 50c on prime95 test. EDIT: Currently in 2019, and a different PC system, this cooler is going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Don Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Quiet operation so far
customer_reviews.text: recent new build on 6850k Broadwell-E, this AIO cooler is actually my biggest surprise of the build. While others have complained about noise, my experience is the opposite. This thing is dead quiet overall in operation. My temps are 30c idle with 4.3g overclock! Under full overhead stress test, the temps dont past 55c, even with hot ambient conditions. This is my first AIO cpu cooler, if the pump and other system components last, its well worth it. I'm truly impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Infected_Autoreiv

customer_reviews.title: It was my first time using an All-In-One (AIO) water-cooling solution and it was super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This has been cooling my overclocked Ryzen 7 1700 for a week now. It was my first time using an All-In-One (AIO) water-cooling solution and it was super easy to install. Keeps my CPU temps in the 60s even under heavy load. It also comes with an AM4 now, so there's no need to contact Corsair to have them ship you one for free. Great value here!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best in the business
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much the top name in self-contained liquid cooling. You cannot go wrong with one of these bad boys. You will not find a better cooler for a better price. It can handle pretty much everything. I personally like my rigs to run as silent as possible and this delivers. You will barely hear it running even in the most intense conditions. Would highly recommend to anyone building a rig both veteran and beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: It won't die!!!
customer_reviews.text: Has been used in two computers and has been abused with aggressive overclocks and heavy thermal loads and still keeps on kickin. Can't ask much more of it. Good performance, good reliability, and reasonable sound levels under load.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Pump does not last
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered this despite the reviews telling me the pump is no good. Sure enough, less than a year later, I am having to go through the RMA process to replace mine. Not only that, I have to pay for return shipping on the faulty one. Don't bother with this one unless you don't mind replacing it and paying for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: bbombassei

customer_reviews.title: Great cooling for my 8700k
customer_reviews.text: Great cooling, great looking and less annoying to install than an air cooler IMO, of course that depends on what case you have but on my NZXT H500i it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome water cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome water cooler. There are one thing in the product description I don't like. This now includes the AM4 bracket. It is not specified anywhere in the description so I spent money that I didn't have to in order to make it fit the AM4 I bought a bracket directly from Corsair. Other than that nice product. I hooked up the usb cable from the pump to the usb header on the motherboard and downloaded the corsair software. From the software I can customize pump and fan speed plus monitor speed of the other chassis fans. easy to use software as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!!! When it works...
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this pump for 9 months or so. Seeing Corsairs 5 year warranty really gave me confidence in the product. However after very light usage the pump just died. Pumps die, so I wasn't too worried. I contacted Corsair and found out they don't cover shipping and the RMA process could take over a month! At this point I don't trust the product or the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Axe

customer_reviews.title: Pump failure, common problem
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a few months then the I started getting choppy mouse movement and loading any software would cause system shutdown. While troubleshooting I figured out that I was getting temps of over 100c. Figured out that the water pump is failing. From reading the reviews this is a common problem. There should be a safety mechanism that alerts the user to hardware failure without having to install additional software.
customer_reviews.author: bard119

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING FOR PC BUILDS
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item because of how compact and how it was compatible with my setup and it works amazing! There are different modes you can set it as, performance, quiet, or normal and it works amazingly. Never had any problems and its been a year since i have installed into my setup. I would highly recommend this product and have no regrets of buying it!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and cool!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to install. It is a big upgrade from the Cooler Master garbage that came in my system. If you have an available USB header, it has great management software that can control all your fans and monitor your GPU.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon H.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit NZXT Kraken G10
customer_reviews.text: I have had the CORSAIR HYDRO SERIES H55 AIO for 3 years and was looking forward to upgrading to this, but it won't fit. The grooves around the pump are just barely too shallow to allow it to fit into the Kraken G10. I tried for an hour to get it to fit. I even tried using vicegrips and bending the cooler itself to get it to fit with no luck. Now i have a scratched up Corsair Hydro I can't even use and no one will want to buy. It's very annoying that the design was not consistent enough between the H55 and this to allow for me to use it on the Kraken G10.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Essex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.text: The RGB feature is fairly lame in my opinion. Yes it's there, but it's only on the logo. However, in terms of ease of installation and being user-friendly, I couldn't ask for any improvement. Everything plugged right in and worked right away and hasn't had a single issue in two months now.
customer_reviews.author: Crage Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great product bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -dropped my Ryzen down to 32 degrees Celsius under a load. -Looks great on my rig Cons: -the radiator was recieved damaged -the hoses are not to flexible Other thoughts: -This package does come with AM4 brackets, I know because now I have 2. -if you have a 460x you will most likely have to mount it on the front of the case. -So I bought this product on Black Friday, and some how in the process of delivery it got lost. FedEx would not do anything to help but surprisingly amazon replied very swiftly by refunding the product and offering free shipping on the repurchase of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jericho

customer_reviews.title: The holes for mounting the fans and the radiator to ...
customer_reviews.text: The holes for mounting the fans and the radiator to the case are not very well drilled out and causes the outer cover of the radiator to bend when trying to install it. Very big QC issue. Another issue is that it came with fins slightly bent, before I took it out of its protective wrapping
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend because the fans are awful
customer_reviews.text: This aio will cool your cpu properly but after 3 months of use it started to run very loud and make a noise similar to the preditor. The only fix I could find was to replace the fans but that is slightly upsetting considering the cost of the h100i v2. I weighed the fan down with 2 eye bolts and it seemed to fix the problem, that being said this problem should not exist in the first place. The fans are just cheap garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: keeps i7-8700k cool!
customer_reviews.text: even while gaming and the pump being set to the lowest rpm setting, I can play for hours and my i7-8700k (4.7 ghz overclock) only gets up to about 50 C maximum. during stress tests at 100% load, with the highest pump setting, my cpu goes up to about 85 C max. I was worried because I know coffee lake is infamous for hot temps, so I'm super satisfied with the cooling in this! so far I haven't had any problems with it. the LED on the block doesn't have great color accuracy, but considering that's not the reason I bought it, it doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Norman L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Install was easy, but took a moment to determine the correct ...
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this since Black Friday 2017. Been running well and brought CPU temps down about 8 degrees at idle. Install was easy, but took a moment to determine the correct screws for the Intel chip. I had extra fans so I took a fan mounting screw to home Depot and bought 8 more to do a push pull on the radiator. Cooling an i5 4690K OCed to 4.3GHz.
customer_reviews.author: rit

customer_reviews.title: failed on me after 4 months. yep four months ...
customer_reviews.text: failed on me after 4 months. yep four months. They want me to send it in for a replacement. crap
customer_reviews.author: Ben Chosenberg

product_meta.title: CORSAIR Hydro Series H100i v2 AIO Liquid CPU Cooler, 240mm Radiator, Dual 120mm PWM Fans, Advanced RGB Lighting and Fan Software Control
product_meta.description: Style:H100i V2The Hydro Series H100i v2 is an extreme performance, all-in-one liquid CPU cooler for cases with 240mm radiator mounts. The 240mm radiator and dual SP120L PWM fans provide the excellent heat dissipation you need for highly overclocked CPUs. Corsair Link is built in, so you can monitor temperatures, adjust cooling performance and customize LED lighting directly from your desktop. Compatible with CORSAIR iCUE
feature_bullets: Customizable RGB pump head produces vivid lighting effects to match your build
Custom-designed SP120L fans deliver high static pressure and incredible airflow
PWM fan-speed control allows you to run your fans anywhere between 850 RPM to 2,435 RPM
CORSAIR iCUE software allows you to customize RGB lighting, individual fan speeds, and pump speed while monitoring CPU and coolant temperatures, and more
Compatible Sockets: Intel LGA 115x, 1366, 2011, 2011-3, 2066 and AMD FM1, FM2, AM2, AM3, AM4

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,684 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
